location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Captains Charles Elphinstone and Lawrence Nilson, Commanders in Chief of Company's Marine and Military Forces in the Gulph of Persia [Persian Gulf]

mods.abstract: The letter relays the news that the sheikhs of Bushire have agreed to send five boats to assist against Carrack [Kharg Island].A postscript, dated 21 May 1768, reports that due to lack of water and other supplies it was possible to send only four of the five boats.
